February 25, 1969
Mr. Robert D. Swezey
Secretary-Treasurer
Corporation for Public Broadcasting
1250 Connecticut Avenue, N. W.
Washington, D. C. 20036
Dear Mr. Swezey:
Attached is the listing of educational radio stations
for possible statistical review by ARB. I have listed
the stations according to the fifty major TV markets,
which I am assuming also include radio. There is a
fairly even national distribution/
Those stations which have asterisks before the city I
consider to be the most representative educational radio
stations. Also included with these are the nine addit¬
ional stations of interest noted at the end of the
listing. These stations are not included in the top
fifty markets.
The second attachment includes those stations with
adequate production facilities and staff to produce a
program, series or project for the Experiments with
Sound CPB grant.
I spoke briefly with Herman Land this afternoon. In
the morning I will be calling a number of NER station
managers urging them to send proposals for the Experi¬
mental Sounds grant to the Corporation and Herman Land.
At the same time, I will urge them to contact others in
their area to do the same. Hopefully, we may begin to
feel the fruits of our efforts by sometime early next
week. We will continue to encourage our member stations
through our upcoming Memo to Managers to submit proposals
as rapidly as possible in order that these efforts will
have some impact on the upcoming legislative hearings.
We will continue to keep you and Herman Land informed
as we make our contacts. If there is anything else we
can do at this time, please let us know and we will
contribute in whatever way we can.
Sincerely,
Lucinda K. Landreth
Administrative Assistant
